Header: The CID to arrest another group of suspects on abductions
Content: The Criminal Investigations Department informed the court today that another group of suspects will be arrested over the alleged disappearance of 11 persons in the Kotahena area. Navy Lieutenant Commander Chandana Prasad Hettiarachchi who is remand custody in connection with the case was further remanded. He was ordered to be remanded until the 9th of this month by Fort Magistrate RangaDissanayake. Chief Inspector of the CID Nishantha Silva further said that a Navy officer was ready to give a strong witness about the incident. The Magistrate ordered to make the statement in the official chamber of the court. Meanwhile, the court stated that the ruling on the case against M.P. Johnston Fernando will be announced on the 29th of this month regarding the allegation of not submitting asset declarations for the year 2010 to the Presidential Secretariat. The hearing on this case was completed before. Accordingly, the complainants and the defendants filed written submissions on the case. The case has been filed by the Bribery Commission.
